title: Riot's AutoBan system for "Toxic" is TOO SOFT!
body: This system is way too soft. It should be banning people for hate speech, not just for someone saying "are you stupid" because someone is spam pinging you for not committing suicide with them. Hate speech is speech which attacks a person or group on the basis of attributes such as race, religion, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, disability, or gender. Hate speech is not when you call someone stupid, or tell someone what they are doing is stupid. Or telling someone they suck. Trash talking and toxicity have a pretty fine line. Telling someone 'kys' or using racist/homophobic slurs is what you guys should be looking for. Not for someone saying "are you stupid". My friend got banned because he was defending me in a game. Some guy was being super racist spamming n**** word to me and my friend was telling him to shut the f*** up and that he is a dumb a**. Trash talking shouldn't be bannable, at least not in circumstances like this. It's like the saying "treat others the way you want to be treated". Nobody wants to just be quiet and report someone like that, we want to stand up for ourselves. I think anyone who simple is just trash talking should be allowed to trash talk and if someone wants to trash talk them back they can. This whole automated system sucks. It's way too soft. I remember back when we had player tribunals. That was so much better. Only REAL toxic people were getting banned. If someone was just defending themselves they wouldn't get banned by the automated system. At least I know I wouldn't ban them (I used to help with tribunal). I think this automated system is way too flawed, at least any account that's been flagged for a 14 day/permanent ban should be manual reviewed by a player/rioter and not just by 1 person, I think it should be by 3-5 people and if all 3/3 or 5/5 agree to ban only then do they get punished. Not just 2/3 or 4/5 a full 5/5 or 3/3 otherwise they get to keep playing. My idea isn't the best, but I know for damn sure it's better than this automated system. This automated system is handing out bans left and right and I've heard multiple stories now of people contacting support and getting unbanned because they didn't deserve the punishment that was given.

Freedom of speech and endangering someone physically are on completely different levels. My argument is that system is wrong. If the system did represent what you're saying then yes it makes perfect sense, but it doesn't. It's more like telling someone if you get raped you're not allowed to defend yourself or else you also go to prison. In some countries that's actually true. It has something to do with giving the attacker a fair fight. Which to me is complete bullshit, and the reason I'm happy living in America knowing if someone tries to rape me I got my .45 ready. Riot is just way too soft with punishment system. It should be going for attackers only not defenders.

Freedom of Speech only applies to Government censorship. Since Riot isn't a part of the U.S. Government, Freedom of Speech does not apply to them punishing you for breaking the rules of their game.

Second; Rape is a bad analogy. Pretty much, most real-world analogies are bad ones when referring to League's rules and punishment system.

You are given _all of the tools necessary_ to defend yourself from a flamer. If they start flaming you, insulting you, etc., you _mute them_. There is no need to retaliate when you could squelch their chat altogether and not have to deal with them flaming you. Retaliating only makes you a flamer, that, now, at least three other people have to deal with in their match.

If you decide to disregard all the tools and means of defense Riot gives you, and break the rules to fight back against the flamer, the punishment you'll inevitably receive is wholly justified.

And, allow me to reiterate this point:

**When you retaliate against a flamer, you _become_ a flamer yourself. You're no longer defending yourself, you're attacking someone else. If you want to defend yourself, _use the mute feature Riot gave you_. _Do not retaliate against flamers._**

That's not a good way to defend yourself. Anyone that gets flamed gets no reward from just muting a flamer. In fact if you just mute them they win. They get to feel high and mighty and usually it just makes them troll in game. Which we all know riot doesn't ban people for trolling I see tons of troll never get banned EVER. Only people that doesn't realize this are low elo noobs. Straight up everyone in diamond+ doesn't give a fuck about toxic, we just want TROLLS/Boosted kids to get banned. The opposite always happens. I got 2 accounts in Masters and whenever I play on my D5 smurf always ALWAYS someone on my team or enemy team is clearly boosted and doesn't deserve to be there. And I see people "flame" them for ruining the game and they deserve it. They ruined the game for everyone. They give me free win or give my enemies a free win.

You would be surprised how effective a method of defense shutting out someone's chat is. Sure, it doesn't prevent trolling, but it is still a very good way of defending oneself.

You're not supposed to be rewarded for muting a flamer or not stooping down to their level - besides, there _is_ a reward in it. Keeping your account in good standing.

There's no such thing as "winning" in a discussion or argument, and the flamer "winning" or "feeling high and mighty" goes away pretty fast once you report them and they get punished.

To quote Jericho Swain; "_Any man who must say 'we are winning', is not truly winning._"

So, which do you think is better? Muting a flamer and getting no satisfaction, but keeping your account in good standing and avoiding punishment, or retaliating against the flamer, and getting yourself punished?

Hell, the [Summoner's Code](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/) even has a quote from Euripides that I think fits here. "_Short is the joy that guilty pleasure brings._"

So, again, which is better? Sacrificing personal gratification for your account's safety, or sacrificing your account's safety for personal gratification? (I personally vote the former. Better that I get to keep playing League than get to "put someone in their place".)

---

As for Trolls...You don't know whether or not they get banned, but from seeing some of the threads on this board, I know that they do. Riot just prefers not to place bans unless they have proof beyond a reasonable doubt that the person in question was trolling.

It sucks the amount of harm that the safe approach causes to others, and Riot knows it, but it's really the only way to do it without excess collateral damage. Because some people who report others for trolling may not themselves really know if the person _was_ trolling or not.
